channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Thames Water ripped up pavers to repair a leak and never repaired the pavement, 5th September
item.description:
Thames Water came to repair a leak under the footpath outside 27 John Adam St WC2N 6AS several months ago and have never returned to properly replace the pavers. The damage is now quite deep and is an urgent trip hazard. I have contacted Thames Water about this but have had zero response from them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, John Adam Street, Waterloo, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping/littering around our bins, 5th September
item.description:
Bin bags are being left in front of our bins constantly. On this occasion foxes have helped themselves to the bins and now it stinks of fox sick at our entrance and have litter all over the place can this be cleaned up please and more done to help Dunn St.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunn Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flat Iron rubbish collection, 5th September
item.description:
Flat Iron rubbish was not picked up yesterday due to bus crash opposite. Unfortunately the restaurant still out our more rubbish. This has resulted in swarms of wasps and flies. Can they use thicker bags or better still get wheelie bins?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: My written off van is being collected next week by copart., 5th September
item.description:
My written-off VW campervan is being collected next week by the insurance company (Copart). Parking restrictions come in next week. I don't believe it makes sense to apply for a permit for it. Please can you clarify.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive Weeding, 5th September
item.description:
There is a lot of weeding on the footpath next to my house and it’s also allowing trespassers to throw stuff and litter the footpath. Please send some weed control team to deal with this problem immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Cedarhurst Drive, Horn Park, London

item.title: The flags have been put up on every other lamp post, 5th September
item.description:
A number of St George’s flags have been placed on lamp posts on these roads, we know they have been clearly put there for political reasons and is part of a national protest against immigration and immigrants and is causing racial tension in the area can these be removed urgently unless Bromley agrees with this approach and has authorised for this far right group of racist thugs to continue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Marion Crescent, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
